result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Wayne Dobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $543 costs, consecutive to sentence.
Huber for diversion only.  Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 1-12-2016; to Report by 3-11-2016.  If not, Commitment to issue without huber  privileges and new criminal charges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jonathan Wayne Dobson in court with attorney Sean Drury.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 10 days Rock Co Jail with Huber for diversion only; 1 day sentence credit; 10 consecutive days Rock Co Jail in lieu of costs.

Defendant Jonathan Wayne Dobson in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May have one time 3rd party to pick up personal belongings.
